text: The 2018–19 Rink Hockey European Female League is the 13th season of Europe's premier female club roller hockey competition organized by CERH. ==Format== Fourteen teams joined the first round while title holders Gijón and another team by luck of the draw, got a wildcard for the quarterfinals. == Teams == Fourteen teams from five federations joined the competition. {| class="wikitable" style="white-space: nowrap;" |- ! colspan=4 |Participating teams |- | width=200| GijónTH | width=200| Mérignac | width=200| Benfica |- | Manlleu | Noisy le Grand | Stuart |- | Voltregà | Nantes Métropole | Vordemwald |- | Palau de Plegamans | Iserlohn | Montreux |- | Coutras | Bison Calenberg | |- |} ==Results== ===Preliminary round=== The first leg was played on 10 November and the second leg on 1 December 2018. Montreux got a wildcard for the quarterfinals. |} ===Quarterfinals=== The first leg was played on 12 January 2019 and the second leg on 18 February 2019. |} ==See also== *2018–19 CERH European League *2018–19 CERS Cup * World Skate Europe - all competitions ==References== ==External links== * Category:Rink Hockey European Female League CERH CERH
title: 2018–19 Rink Hockey European Female League
